page.title: Introduction
page.p: This tutorial will work by providing you with some tasks to accomplish and then walking you through the solutions step-by-step. However, since doing anything at all on the command-line will require some base-level skills, we'll start by explaining the first commands and concepts you'll need to start on the tasks. This is covered in Practical Intro

If you enjoy reading long texts, there are also some tips for how to think about Unix systems in general, and bash scripting in particular, all found in the Philosophy Intro. If you prefer to just get coding straight away, feel free to skip this for now. Or forever. It is non-essential, and my feelings won't be hurt, I promise.
